author: Reuters Editorial
title: South Africa's Zuma to challenge decision to prosecute him in graft case
text:
JOHANNESBURG (Reuters) - South Africa’s Jacob Zuma will mount a legal challenge against the decision of the National Prosecuting Authority to take him to court on corruption charges, the former president’s lawyer said on Monday.
FILE PHOTO: South Africa's President Jacob Zuma announces his resignation at the Union Buildings in Pretoria, South Africa, February 14, 2018. REUTERS/Siphiwe Sibeko/File Photo Zuma is due to appear in court on April 6 to face charges of fraud, racketeering and money laundering relating to a years-old $2.5 billion arms deal. He denies any wrongdoing.
Reporting by Joe Brock; Editing by James Macharia
